reviews.review_msg: Incredible lecturer and seems to really care about the subject matter and the students. We went through a lot of material in a short amount of time and the lectures didn't always stretch to cover all of it, but otherwise the course was well-designed. You will not pass if you can't think critically about a text!!!

as a science student, the class was pretty tough, but SO interesting and thought provoking. David is super funny and a really nice and passionate prof, and his lectures were awesome. the course has pretty intense subject matter but he took a really respectful approach while still allowing room for discussion. get physical copies of all the books

Professor Coley was great! He made the lectures engaging and enjoyable (especially if you've done the readings) and really guides you in understanding the material. The assignments are fairly straightforward and talking to him (and your TA) outside of lecture will really guarantee your success. Overall great dude and has the cutest dog everrr!

Professor Coley is entertaining and has good lectures. He relies strongly on books to help you understand and as long as you keep up with the readings you'll be able to enjoy/be present during lecture. I encourage going to his office hours and establishing a relationship with your TA as well for highest success.

I really recommend Michael's Engl 209 class. The readings he chose were fantastic, and he really cared about what we had to say. He ran my tutorial once, and was an absolute gem at guiding discussions. This class deals with heavy, traumatic content so be prepared. Also talk to him if you're struggling--he's understanding & flexible.

This class in particular dealt with heavy topics, and Everton gave them the respect they deserved. I wish he provided clearer criteria for the essays, but he does everything in the interest of his students - he even took the time to prepare us for the final. Take good notes and keep up with the readings. His lectures are always great

Dr. Evertons lectures have been my favourite to attend out of all the classes Ive taken. He is not an easy marker so do not take this for an easy grade, you will most definitely need to heavily edit your papers if you want a good mark. Important subject matter discussed in this class, but deals with a lot of trauma.

Lectures help explain the books you read but going to tutorials will help you just fine (if you have an engaging group). No final just analysis and essays so you HAVE to read. They can be very long but pacing yourself will help you. Lectures themselves get complicated sometimes with overload of information.
